page.title: 03Cows at North Hawkwell Farm.
page.content:
Mr. Schofield has 65 cows and 64 calves and one cow is in calf. The breeds he has are short horn cross and Hereford cross. Mr. Schofield hires bulls and sells calves at Cutcombe market. He hires a Charolais bull and a Hereford bull. Mr. Schofield mates the Charolais bull to his cows and the Hereford bull to his heifers.
The calves are six weeks old when Mr. Schofield sells them. He sells his calves for meat.
Mr. Schofield lets his cows graze from April to December. He has one modern cow shed where he keeps the cows in the winter. Mr. Schofield only milks cows when they have too much milk.
